abstract: The vice president worked to corral support for legislation that Democrats say would put thousands of laid-off teachers and public safety workers back on the job.
snippet: The vice president worked to corral support for legislation that Democrats say would put thousands of laid-off teachers and public safety workers back on the job.
lead_paragraph: 10:47 p.m. | Updated Back on his old stomping grounds at the Senate on Wednesday afternoon, Vice President Joseph R. Biden, Jr. outlined dire consequences if Republicans blocked a $35 billion piece of President Obama's jobs bill.

headline.main: Biden Visits Capitol Hill to Rally Support for Jobs Legislation
